name: Cassava Flour Tortillas
author: Buckwheat Queen
summary: Soft and pliable, these easy-to-make cassava flour tortillas taste similar to a whole wheat tortilla but are naturally gluten free. Use them for your sloppiest filling, and you'll be surprised how well they hold up and how delicious they taste!
directions: Prepare a tortilla press with 2 pieces of parchment paper
Pour warm water into a bowl and stir in salt until it dissolves
Combine flour, salt water, and oil in a bowl and mix with your hands until a smooth dough forms
Move dough to a smooth surface and lightly knead until dough feels compact and does not crumble
Separate into 4 equal pieces and roll them into balls
Heat a griddle over medium-high heat
Press one dough ball between 2 pieces of parchment paper in the tortilla press
Open press and carefully peel off the top piece of parchment paper
Flip tortilla onto your hand and carefully peel off the 2nd piece of paper
Return paper back onto tortilla press
Immediately cook the pressed tortilla on the hot griddle
Cook until bubbles form, flip over, and cook on the other side until browned
Do not flip the tortilla before bubbles form or the tortilla will break
Serve immediately or cover with a cloth and reheat in the microwave for 30 seconds at 600W
